com.bsandersen.CabConverter
Class XMLparser

java.lang.Object
  com.bsandersen.CabConverter.XMLparser

public class XMLparser
extends java.lang.Object

This is the interface to the XML parser facility in Java used to consume the contest description files. The expectation is we will find the CCContest folder in the correct place for this platform: ~/Documents/CCContests for MacOS X and LINUX users Desktop\CCContests for Windows users

Author:
B. Scott Andersen (NE1RD)

Constructor Summary
XMLparser()
          Constructor Though we are primarily a Macintosh MacLoggerDX utility we give a nod to the Windows world by indicating that the CCContests directory can be placed on the "Desktop" for Windows users.

 Contest findContestByName(java.lang.String name)
          Find the appropriate contest by name and return it
 Contest[] getAllTests()
          This method retrieves a vector of tests created when the test repository directory (holding XML files describing contests) was walked and parsed.
 int getContestCount()
          This method returns the number of valid Contest objects in the Contest[] array returned by getAllTests().
static XMLparser getInstance()
          This method provides access to the reference to this Singleton object

findContestByName

public Contest findContestByName(java.lang.String name)
Find the appropriate contest by name and return it

Parameters:
name - The name of the contest to find
Returns:
A reference to the Contest structure matching the name

getAllTests

public Contest[] getAllTests()
This method retrieves a vector of tests created when the test repository directory (holding XML files describing contests) was walked and parsed.

Returns:
Array of Contest objects

getContestCount

public int getContestCount()
This method returns the number of valid Contest objects in the Contest[] array returned by getAllTests().

Returns:
The number of Contests
